1    | /*******************************************************************
2    | $Header: agwsubs.c 1.0 Sun 07-23-2000 10:08:34 pm $
3    | 
4    | AGW Packet Engine subroutines
5    | These are devellopped under DJGPP environment
6    | 
7    | ********************************************************************/
8    | 
9    | /*+ Default include files +*/
10   | #include <stdio.h>
11   | #include <stdlib.h>
12   | #include <strings.h>
13   | #include <ctype.h>
14   | #include <pc.h>			/*+ For kbhit(), which is not ANSI unfortunately +*/
15   | #include <conio.h>		/*+ For getch(), which is not ANSI unfortunately +*/
16   | 
17   | /*+ The AGWPE include files +*/
18   | #include "fortify.h"
19   | #include "ringbuf.h"
20   | #include "agwhdr.h"
21   | #include "agwpe_if.h"
22   | #include "agwsubs.h"
23   | #include "tn_srv.h"
24   | 
25   | /*--- Global variables  ---*/
26   | char agwpe_version[20];		/*+ String which will be filled with the AGWPE version +*/
27   | char agwpe_portinfo[264];	/*+ String which will be filled with AGWPE port information +*/
28   | int agwpe_status = 0; 		/*+ Start status with everything off +*/
29   | 
30   | /*+ Strings to store mycall and tocall in. This is possible in this
31   |     way as we only support one connection at a time +*/
32   | char mycall[16];			/*+ Space to store mycall in +*/
33   | char tocall[16];			/*+ Space to store other stations callsign in +*/
34   | 
35   | /*--- Local variables  ---*/
36   | static AGWPE_HDR cmdbuffer;			 /*+ AGWPE header which will be used to send commands +*/
37   | static AGWPE_HDR *cmd = &cmdbuffer;	 /*+ A pointer to the AGWPE header defined above +*/
38   | static BYTE databuffer[4096];		 /*+ Buffer to store incoming data in +*/
39   | static BYTE *data = databuffer;		 /*+ A pointer to the buffer, defined above +*/
40   | static RINGBUF *ringbuf;    	 	 /*+ Ringbuffer to store incoming data  +*/
41   | 
42   | 
43   | /*--- Local prototypes  */
44   | static int store_version(BYTE *d);	   	  /*+ Store version string +*/
45   | static char agwhdr_type(AGWPE_HDR *hdr);  /*+++ Return the agwpe 'datakind' +*/
46   | static unsigned long agwhdr_cnt(AGWPE_HDR *hdr);		/*+ Pointer to AGWPE header +*/
47   | static void agwpe_get_portinfo(void);				/*+++ Request port information from AGWPE +*/
48   | 
49   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
50   | Initialize the AGWPE interface by 
51   | setting up tcpip interface,
52   | allocating a ringbuffer for incoming data
53   | get version number and port information of the AGWPE
54   | 
55   | Returns always 1 for success
56   | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
57   | int
58   | agwpe_init(char *address,    /*+ Host name or IP address to use +*/
59   |            char *portnr)     /*+ Port number to use +*/   
60   | /*+ returns 1 for success, 0 on failure +*/
61   | {
62   |   int ret;
63   | 
64   |   /*--- Initialize tcpip  */
65   |   ret = agw_tcp_init(address,portnr);
66   |   if (ret > 0) {
67   |     agwpe_status |= AGWPE_ACTIVE;
68   |     (void) atexit(agw_tcp_close);
69   |   }
70   |   else 
71   |     return(0);
72   | 
73   |   /*--- Allocate and setup the ring buffer */
74   |   ringbuf = ringbuf_create(4096);
75   | 
76   |   /*--- Initialize some local variables so they can be used in  */
77   |   /*--- loop to test if they are initialized */
78   |   agwpe_version[0] = '\0';
79   |   agwpe_portinfo[0] = '\0';
80   | 
81   |   /*--- By default, get version number and port information  */
82   |   agwpe_get_ver();
83   |   while (agwpe_version[0] == '\0') 
84   |     agwpe_process();
85   | 
86   |   agwpe_get_portinfo();
87   |   while (agwpe_portinfo[0] == '\0') 
88   |     agwpe_process();
89   | 
90   |   return(1);
91   | }
92   | 
93   | 
94   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
95   | Get the number which is stored in the AGWPE header as the number
96   | bytes which will follow the header
97   | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
98   | static unsigned long 
99   | agwhdr_cnt(AGWPE_HDR *hdr)		/*+ Pointer to AGWPE header +*/
100  | /*+ Returns the number of bytes indicated by the header +*/
101  | {
102  |   return(hdr->datalen);
103  | }
104  | 
105  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
106  | This function will return the header type (datakind)
107  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
108  | static char 
109  | agwhdr_type(AGWPE_HDR *hdr)		/*+ Pointer to AGWPE header +*/
110  | /*+ Returns the 'datakind' indicated by the header +*/
111  | {
112  |   return(hdr->datakind);
113  | }
114  | 
115  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
116  | This function will calculate the AGWPE version and store
117  | it in the global string
118  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
119  | static int 
120  | store_version(BYTE *d)	/*+ Pointer to buffer, containing the data  +*/
121  | /*+ Returns 1 for success, 0 on failure +*/
122  | {
123  |   int highver;
124  |   int lowver;								  
125  | 
126  |   if (d == NULL)
127  |     return(0);
128  | 
129  |   highver = (int) (d[1]*256+d[0]);	   
130  |   lowver = (int) (d[5]*256+d[4]);
131  |   sprintf(agwpe_version,"%d.%d",highver,lowver);
132  |   return(1);
133  | }
134  | 
135  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
136  | Inquire AGWPE for version number. The version number will
137  | be stored by agw_process in the global string agwpe_version.
138  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
139  | void 
140  | agwpe_get_ver(void)
141  | {
142  |   /* Ask for AGWPE Version Info ('R' frame) */
143  |   memset(cmd,0,sizeof(AGWPE_HDR));
144  |   cmd->datakind='R';									  
145  |   agw_tcp_send((BYTE *)cmd,sizeof(AGWPE_HDR));
146  | }
147  | 
148  | 
149  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
150  | Request AGWPE port information. agw_process will store
151  | it in the global string agwpe_portinfo;
152  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
153  | static void 
154  | agwpe_get_portinfo(void )
155  | {
156  |   /*--- Ask for AGWPE Port information ('G' frame) */
157  |   memset(cmd,0,sizeof(AGWPE_HDR));
158  |   cmd->datakind='G';									  
159  |   agw_tcp_send((BYTE *)cmd,sizeof(AGWPE_HDR));
160  | }
161  | 
162  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
163  | Register a callsign at AGWPE
164  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
165  | int
166  | agwpe_register(char *callsign)  /*+ Callsign to register +*/
167  | {
168  |   memset(cmd,0,sizeof(AGWPE_HDR));
169  |   cmd->datakind='X';
170  |   strcpy(cmd->callfrom,callsign);
171  |   agw_tcp_send((BYTE *)cmd,sizeof(AGWPE_HDR));
172  | 
173  |   /*--- Return failure or success */
174  |   return(1);
175  | }
176  | 
177  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
178  | Unregister the given callsign from AGWPE
179  | 
180  | Returns always 1 for success
181  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
182  | /* History: 20000713 V1.0 */
183  | int
184  | agwpe_unregister(char *callsign    /*+ Callsign to unregister +*/
185  |                            )
186  | {
187  |   memset(cmd,0,sizeof(AGWPE_HDR));
188  |   cmd->datakind='x';
189  |   strcpy(cmd->callfrom,callsign);
190  |   agw_tcp_send((BYTE *)cmd,sizeof(AGWPE_HDR));
191  |   return(1);
192  | }
193  | 
194  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
195  | Enables the monitor function. There will be no confirmation,
196  | but all incoming 'S','U'and 'I' frames will be send to the application.
197  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
198  | int
199  | agwpe_monitor(void)
200  | /*+ Always returns 1 on success +*/
201  | {
202  |   memset(cmd,0,sizeof(AGWPE_HDR));
203  |   cmd->datakind='m';
204  |   agw_tcp_send((BYTE *)cmd,sizeof(AGWPE_HDR));
205  |   return(1);
206  | }
207  | 
208  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
209  | Start a connection to another station
210  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
211  | int
212  | agwpe_connect(int port, char *callsign)
213  | {
214  |   memset(cmd,0,sizeof(AGWPE_HDR));
215  |   cmd->datakind = 'C';
216  |   cmd->port = port;	
217  |   cmd->pid = 0xF0;
218  |   strcpy(cmd->callfrom,mycall);
219  |   strcpy(cmd->callto,callsign);
220  |   printf("agw_connect(%d,%s,%s)",port,mycall,callsign);
221  |   agw_tcp_send((BYTE *)cmd,sizeof(AGWPE_HDR));
222  |   return(1);
223  | }
224  | 
225  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
226  | Disconnect station
227  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
228  | int
229  | agwpe_disconnect(int port, char *callsign)
230  | {
231  |   memset(cmd,0,sizeof(AGWPE_HDR));
232  |   cmd->datakind = 'd';
233  |   cmd->port = port;	
234  |   cmd->pid = 0xF0;
235  |   strcpy(cmd->callfrom,mycall);
236  |   strcpy(cmd->callto,callsign);
237  |   printf("agw_disconnect(%d,%s,%s)",port,mycall,callsign);
238  |   agw_tcp_send((BYTE *)cmd,sizeof(AGWPE_HDR));
239  |   return(1);
240  | }
241  | 
242  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
243  | Ask for list of heard stations
244  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
245  | int
246  | agwpe_heard(int port)
247  | {
248  |   memset(cmd,0,sizeof(AGWPE_HDR));
249  |   cmd->datakind = 'H';
250  |   cmd->port = port;	
251  |   agw_tcp_send((BYTE *)cmd,sizeof(AGWPE_HDR));
252  |   return(1);
253  | }
254  | 
255  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
256  | Send data over the connection to another station
257  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
258  | int
259  | agwpe_send_data(int port, char *callsign, char *data)
260  | {
261  |   memset(cmd,0,sizeof(AGWPE_HDR));
262  |   cmd->datakind = 'D';
263  |   cmd->port = port;	
264  |   cmd->pid = 0xF0;
265  |   strcpy(cmd->callfrom,mycall);
266  |   strcpy(cmd->callto,callsign);
267  |   cmd->datalen = strlen(data);
268  |   agw_tcp_send((BYTE *)cmd,sizeof(AGWPE_HDR));
269  |   agw_tcp_send((BYTE *)data,cmd->datalen);
270  |   return(1);
271  | }
272  | 
273  | 
274  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
275  | Print header part of an received S,U,I or T frame
276  | by determining were the CR is, and the print everything
277  | in front of this as a regular string, terminated with a '\n'
278  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
279  | /* 20000716 V1.0 */
280  | void
281  | agwpe_printhdr(BYTE *data)
282  | {
283  |   BYTE *p = NULL;
284  | 
285  |   p = data;
286  |   while (*p != 0x0D)
287  |     printf("%c",(char)*p++);
288  |   printf("\n");
289  | }
290  | 
291  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
292  | Print data=r part of an received S,U,I or T frame
293  | by determining were the CR is, and the print everything
294  | after this, terminated with a '\n'
295  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
296  | /* 20000716 V1.0 */
297  | void
298  | agwpe_printdata(BYTE *p, 	/*+ Pointer to data to print +*/
299  |  		        int len)   	/*+ Number of databytes to print +*/
300  | {
301  |   int i = 0;
302  | 
303  |   /*--- Check if there is anything to print  */
304  |   if (len == 0) {
305  |     return;
306  |   }
307  | 
308  |   /*--- If there is a CR, then point just after that  */
309  |   /*--- This was only intended to be used in a monitored frame  */
310  | //  p = strchr((char *)data,0x0D);  /*--- Is there a Carriage Return ? */
311  | //  if (p) {				  /*--- Yes, found CR  */
312  | //	p++; 				  /*--- Point to next character  */
313  | //  }
314  | 
315  |   /*--- Print the data  */
316  |   for (i=0 ; i<len ; i++) {
317  |     printf("%c",*p);
318  | 	if ( (*p == 0x0D) && (*(p+1) != 0x0A))
319  | 	  printf("\n");
320  | 	p++;
321  |   }
322  | 
323  | }
324  | 
325  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
326  | Return the length of the data, as indicated in the AGWPE header like
327  | 1:Fm PA3BTL-1 To BEACON <UI pid=F0 Len=64 >[10:34:24]
328  | will return 64
329  | 
330  | Returns length of the following data
331  | If the string "Len=" is not found, function will return 0.
332  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
333  | /* 20000716 V1.0 */
334  | 
335  | int 
336  | agwpe_datalen(BYTE *data)		/*+ Pointer to incoming message +*/
337  | {
338  |   char *p = NULL;
339  |   int len = 0;
340  | 
341  |   p = strstr((char *) data,"Len=");
342  |   if (p) {
343  |     len = atoi(p+4);
344  | 	return(len);
345  |   }
346  |   else
347  |     return(0);
348  | }
349  | 
350  | 
351  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
352  | Process all incoming data from AGWPE
353  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
354  | /* 20000714 V1.0 */
355  | void
356  | agwpe_process(void)
357  | {
358  |   static AGWPE_HDR agwheader; 	 /*+ Incoming AGWPE header +*/
359  |   static AGWPE_HDR *hdr = &agwheader;  /*+ Pointer to header defined above +*/
360  |   size_t cnt = 0;		/*+ Number of databytes which will follow the header +*/
361  |   char type;
362  |   int  datalen = 0;
363  |   int  ret = 0;
364  |   char tempstr[256];
365  |   int  i;
366  | 
367  |   /*--- Check if there is incoming TCP data. If so, store it in the ringbuffer */
368  |   get_tcp_data(ringbuf);
369  | 
370  |   /*--- As long as there is a agwpe header in the ringbuffer  */
371  |   while (agwhdr_available(ringbuf))
372  |   {
373  |     ret = agwhdr_get(ringbuf,hdr);     /*--- Retrieve the header */
374  | 	if (ret <= 0)
375  | 	  break;
376  | 	type = agwhdr_type(hdr);
377  | 
378  | 	/*--- Number of databytes, following header  */
379  | 	cnt = agwhdr_cnt(hdr);			
380  | 	if (cnt > 0)
381  | 	{
382  | 	  /*--- Get specified number of databytes and store it in local buffer */
383  | 	  agwdata_get(ringbuf,cnt,data);  
384  |     }
385  | 
386  |     // Do something with the data
387  | 
388  |     switch(hdr->datakind) {
389  | 
390  | 	  /*--- Connection  */
391  |       case 'C': agwpe_printdata(data,cnt);
392  | 	            #ifdef TN_SRV
393  | 				  tn_printf("%s\r\n",data);
394  | 				#endif
395  | 				/*--- Set flag that we are connected to another station  */
396  | 				agwpe_status |= STATION_CONNECTED;
397  | 				/*--- Go out of command mode in converse mode  */
398  | 				agwpe_status &= ~CMD_MODE;			
399  | 	            break;
400  | 
401  |       /*--- Disconnection  */
402  |       case 'd': agwpe_printdata(data,cnt);
403  | 	  			#ifdef TN_SRV
404  | 				  tn_printf("%s\r\n",data);
405  | 				#endif
406  | 				/*--- Reset flag as we are not connected to another station anymore  */
407  | 				agwpe_status &= ~STATION_CONNECTED;
408  | 				/*--- Go out of converse in command mode  */
409  | 				agwpe_status |= CMD_MODE;			
410  | 	            break;
411  | 
412  | 	  /*--- Data frame  */
413  | 	  case 'D':	memset(tempstr,'\0',256);
414  | 				memcpy(tempstr,data,cnt);
415  | 				agwpe_printdata(tempstr,cnt);
416  | 				#ifdef TN_SRV
417  |   				  tn_printf("\r\n<%s>\r\n",tempstr);
418  | 				#endif
419  | 				break;
420  | 
421  | 	  /*--- Heard stations list  */
422  | 	  case 'H':	i = 0;
423  | 				/*--- Empty heardlist entry ?  */
424  | 				if (data[0] == ' ' && data[1] == ' ')
425  | 				  break;
426  | 				/*--- Print station, data and time information  */
427  | 				while (isprint(data[i])) {
428  | 				  printf("%c",data[i]);
429  | 				  #ifdef TN_SRV
430  | 				    tn_printf("%c",data[i]);
431  | 				  #endif
432  | 				  i++;
433  | 				}
434  | 				printf("\n");
435  | 				#ifdef TN_SRV
436  | 				  tn_printf("\r\n");
437  | 				#endif
438  | 				break;
439  | 
440  | 
441  |                 /*--- version number response  */
442  |       case 'R': store_version(data);
443  |                 break;
444  | 
445  |                 /*--- port information response  */
446  |       case 'G': strcpy(agwpe_portinfo, (char *)data);
447  |                 break;
448  | 
449  |                 /*--- registration response  */
450  |       case 'X': if (*data == 0)
451  |                   printf("Failed to register %s\n",hdr->callfrom);
452  |                 else
453  |                   printf("Successfully registered %s\n",hdr->callfrom);
454  |                 break;
455  | 
456  |       case 'S':
457  | 	  case 'I':										 
458  | 	  case 'U':	/*--- Monitor frames  */
459  | 	  			printf("\n--------------------------------------------\n");
460  | 				agwpe_printhdr(data);
461  | 				datalen = agwpe_datalen(data);
462  | 				agwpe_printdata(data,datalen);
463  | 				break;
464  | 
465  | 	  case 'T': /*--- Frames which are sent by our AGWPE engine  */
466  | 	  			/*--- Don't print these frames  */
467  | 	  			break;		
468  | 
469  |                 /*--- Unimplemented response  */
470  |       default:  printf("Unimplemented header type %c\n",hdr->datakind);
471  |                 break;
472  |     }					   
473  | 
474  | 	/*--- See if more data is coming in  */
475  |     get_tcp_data(ringbuf);
476  |   }
477  | 
478  | }
479  | 
480  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
481  | Description: Get AGWPE header out of the ringbuffer
482  | Space for the header has to be allocated before calling this function.
483  | 
484  | Returns 1 on success, 0 if no header was available
485  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
486  | int
487  | agwhdr_get(RINGBUF *buf,   /*+ Pointer to ringbuffer to get data from +*/
488  |            AGWPE_HDR *hdr  /*+ Pointer to header to store data in +*/)
489  | {
490  |   int i;
491  |   BYTE c;
492  |   BYTE *p = (BYTE *)hdr;
493  | 
494  |   /*--- Check if memory was allocated  ---*/
495  |   if (hdr == NULL) {
496  |     perror("No AGWPE header allocated");
497  | 	exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
498  |   }
499  | 
500  |   /*--- Check if there is a header available  ---*/
501  |   if (ringbuf_cnt(buf) < sizeof(AGWPE_HDR)) 
502  |   {
503  |     return(0);		/*--- There was no header available  */
504  |   }
505  | 
506  |   /*--- If a header is available, get it out  ---*/
507  |   if (agwhdr_available(buf)) 
508  |   {
509  |     for (i=0 ; i < (int)sizeof(AGWPE_HDR) ; i++) {
510  |       ringbuf_get(buf,&c);
511  |       p[i] = (BYTE)c;
512  |     }
513  |     return(1);
514  |   }
515  | 
516  |   return(0);	// Just in case
517  | }
518  | 
519  | /*++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
520  | Description: Get data from the console, and handle it as if it
521  | came from the telnet client.
522  | +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
523  | int
524  | get_con_data (RINGBUF *ringbuf)		/*+ Pointer to ringbuf +*/
525  | /*+ Returns number of bytes received (>=0) +*/
526  | {
527  |   #define BUFSIZE 256 	/*+ This is a static size for now +*/
528  |   BYTE buf[BUFSIZE];    
529  |   int t = 0;         
530  |   int i;
531  |   int c;
532  | 
533  |   if (!kbhit())
534  |     return(0);
535  | 
536  |   /*@+matchanyintegral@*/  /*--- Avoid LCLINT warning  */
537  | 
538  |   /*--- Store incoming data in own ring buffer  ---*/
539  |   t = 0;
540  |   while (kbhit() && (c=getch()) != EOF) {
541  |     ringbuf_put(ringbuf,c);
542  | 	buf[t++] = c;
543  |   }
544  |   buf[t] = '\0';
545  | 
546  |   /*--- Echo incoming data to standard output  */
547  |   for (i=0 ; i<t ; i++) {
548  |     /*--- Check for the special character to go back to command mode  */
549  | 	if (buf[i] == 0x01) {			/*--- CTRL-C will go back to cmd mode  */
550  | 	  agwpe_status |= CMD_MODE;		/*--- Set command mode flag */
551  | 	  return(t);					/*--- Return now  */
552  | 	}
553  |     printf("%c",buf[i]);	
554  | 	#ifdef TN_SRV
555  | 	  tn_printf("%c",buf[i]);		/*--- Echo back to telnet client  */
556  | 	#endif
557  |   }
558  | 
559  |   return(t); 	/*--- Return number of bytes received  */
560  |   /*@=matchanyintegral@*/	/*--- Restore original LCLINT value */
561  | }
562  | 
563  |
